casebody.data:
Hazel L. GLESENKAMP, Appellant, v. NATIONWIDE MUTUAL INSURANCE CO., Appellee. No. 74-2326. United States Court of Appeals, Ninth Circuit. July 20, 1976. Ernest M. Thayer, of Carroll, Burdick & McDonough, San Francisco, Cal., for appellant. Guy O. Kornblum and William D. Hunter, of Pettit, Evers & Martin, San Francisco, Cal., for appellee.

Before ELY and CARTER, Circuit Judges, and BURNS,* District Judge.

Honorable James M. Burns, United States District Judge, District of Oregon, sitting by designation.

OPINION

PER CURIAM:

Upon the basis of the very carefully reasoned “MEMORANDUM OF OPINION AND ORDER”, written by District Judge Renfrew and reported at 71 F.R.D. 1 (N.D. Cal.1976),1 the District Court’s judgment is

AFFIRMED.

. Another of Judge Renfrew’s opinions that pertains to the controversy is reported at 344 F.Supp. 517 (N.D.Cal.1972).
